lines.text: To the west, there is nothing. Except America.
I want to speak to your son George.
George is in his bedroom.
Oh, not ill, I hope.
He's locked in his bedroom with his Bible and some bread and cheese, and he'll not be out until tomorra' mornin'.
I never heard of anything so preposterous!
Did you ever hear of the Fourth Commandment?
Of course, I have!
Remember the...
You needn't repeat it. I learned the Commandment years ago.
More shame to you then that yeh should lead my son away from righteousness.
Mrs. Campbell, at this very moment our troops are fighting in North Africa. The Germans don't stop fighting on Sunday, so how can we?

What the Germans do, Mr. Waggett, is on their own conscience, and Toddy is not in North Africa, so there's no need to bring the heathens into it. I've been told that there are cannibals in Africa, but no one is going to persuade my son to eat human flesh.
No one's asking your son to eat human flesh!
Not yet!
I insist on speaking to George himself!
You could go down on your bended kness, amd I'll not let you speak to George!
I certainly shall not do that!

[Contemptuously]
Hah!
[Turns and closes the door]

[describing the inhabitants of Todday as children run out of a cottage]
A happy people, with few and simple pleasures.
My men are experts.
So are the Todday people, at hiding whisky!
It's a well known fact that some men were born two drinks below par.

[Speaking about the islanders]
They're so unsporting. They don't do things for the sake of doing them like the English. We play the game for the sake of the game. Other nations play the game for the sake of winning it.
